title: BBC Local Live: Shropshire on Monday 9 May 2016 - BBC News
summary: retired telford vicar found guilty of indecently assaulting girl .
alton towers defends decision to bar shrewsbury woman with one hand from ride .
shrewsbury 's £ 1m quantum leap sculpture needs repair .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: live updates for shropshire have finished for the day , but we 'll be back from 08:00 on tuesday with the latest news , sport , travel and weather .

documents.title: fly-tippers face on-the-spot fines
text: fly-tippers face on-the-spot fines

documents.title: weather : a clear end to the day , but rain overnight
text: the rest of the day should stay dry and warm , but we 're expecting some rain overnight .
author: Alexandra Hamilton
BBC Weather

documents.title: alton towers bars one-handed rider
text: alton towers bars one-handed rider

documents.title: rape-threat vicar guilty of sex attack
text: rape-threat vicar guilty of sex attack

documents.title: video : council bill to clean up rubbish left by travellers
text: shropshire council says it 'll cost at least £ 200 to clean up rubbish left behind by travellers in the battlefield area of shrewsbury .
the travellers , who were there over the weekend , left waste including food , plastic bags and tyres .
they were given notice to leave by the council when they arrived there on friday .

documents.title: warehouse collapse investigation handed over to council
text: the investigation into the collapse of all that shelving at the edwards transport warehouse near hinstock is now in the hands of shropshire council .
the authority says the health and safety executive has handed over the reins after inspecting the site earlier today , but the hse will remain involved .

documents.title: diocese of hereford defends handling of indecent assault allegations
text: the diocese of hereford has defended its decision to wait 16 years before reporting allegations that one of its vicars had been accused of a indecent assault in 1995 .
after a review of old files , it eventually reported the case to the police in 2014 and today 64-year-old kevin mcgarahan was found guilty of the offence .
the diocese claimed the victims , who reported the crimes in 1998 , asked for no action to be taken other than to ask mr mcgarahan was spoken to , so it acted in accordance with their wishes .
it said as mcgarahan had left the hereford diocese by that time , it passed the information on to his new employer , the british army .

documents.title: headlines : retired vicar guilty of indecent assault ; shrewsbury sculpture needs repairs
text: these are our top stories this evening :
- retired telford vicar found guilty of indecently assaulting girl
- woman with one hand 'hurt and upset ' at being barred from rollercoaster
- shrewsbury 's quantum leap sculpture in need of repairs
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather watchers : warm but overcast around shropshire
text: although it 's been warm today , it 's been pretty overcast around shropshire and this was taken by bbc weather watcher snapper simon near church stretton earlier today .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: shrewsbury 's quantum leap sculpture needs repairs
text: shrewsbury 's controversial quantum leap sculpture has started to crumble around the edges and needs repairing .
it was built to remember charles darwin seven years ago at a cost of £ 1m and has become known locally as the `` slinky spring '' .
shropshire council says it has employed surveyors to look at the damaged rendering , but does n't yet know how much the repairs will cost .

documents.title: football : mellon staying on as shrewsbury manager
text: micky mellon has confirmed he will be the manager of shrewsbury town next season .
last week he told us his future would be shaped by a meeting with his chairman , but it appears he does have roland wycherley 's backing .
with a host of players out of contract , he 'll soon reveal the start of his rebuilding plans with who 'll be offered new deals and who 'll not .
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: shrewsbury woman 'hurt and upset ' at being barred from rollercoaster
text: a shrewsbury woman , who was told she could n't ride on an alton towers rollercoaster because she has one hand , says she is `` angry and upset '' by the incident .
the theme park has apologised and explained the decision was made on safety grounds .
miss pond said she was unhappy at the way she was spoken to by a member of staff on the ride and in a facebook post , she wrote , `` i read the rules of the ride .
you need to be able to walk 25m without help .
and climb a ladder .
well i can assure you i can , nothing is wrong with my legs ! ''

documents.title: volunteers wanted for water vole study
text: the people 's trust for endangered species is looking to recruit volunteers to carry out a water vole study in shropshire .
it 's carrying out an online survey and wants people to check sites where there may already be water voles and also to flag up new areas .

documents.title: shrewsbury dad simon up and running just weeks after donating part of liver to his son
text: a shrewsbury father who donated part of his liver to his son has completed a park run just weeks after the major operation .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: american football : first win of season for shropshire revolution
text: shropshire revolution recorded their first win of the season yesterday , and what a win it was .
they beat humber warhawks 49-0 at oakengates and will have a chance to improve their record to 2-2 when they host lincolnshire bombers this coming sunday .
the team has also arranged a charity match against the staffordshire surge at oakengates on 19 june - a game they 're calling `` the shire bowl '' .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Local Live

documents.title: headlines : ex-vicar guilty of indecent assault ; alton towers defends decision to bar woman with one hand from riding the smiler
text: these are our top stories this afternoon :
- retired telford vicar found guilty of indecently assaulting teenage girl
- alton towers defends decision to bar shrewsbury woman with one hand from ride
- new solar panels for council hq
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Local Live

documents.title: new solar panels at council hq
text: more than 490 solar panels have been installed on the roof of shropshire council 's shirehall headquarters in shrewsbury .
the authority says they cost £ 180,000 and will cut its electricity bill by £ 16,000 a year .
and the council will also make a further £ 1,000 a year by supplying power to the national grid .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : taiko drumming workshop at church stretton music festival
text: one of the noisiest workshops at the church stretton musicfest event over the weekend was the taiko drumming workshop .
here 's a little taste of it .
author: Paul Shuttleworth
Presenter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: breakingformer telford vicar found guilty of indecent assault
text: a retired telford vicar has been found guilty of indecently assaulting a 15-year-old girl .
the reverend kevin mcgarahan , who is 64 , carried out the assault at his home 1995 and has been released on bail until sentencing on 3 june .

documents.title: alton towers responds to complaints by shrewsbury woman
text: alton towers says a shropshire woman with one hand was n't allowed to ride its smiler roller-coaster because it would n't be safe .
sarah pond , from shrewsbury , who was born with part of her left arm missing , criticised the theme park on facebook for excluding her from the ride last friday .

in a statement , the theme park says it 's sorry ms pond did n't get the experience at alton towers that it would like its guests to have , but says the restrictions are set by ride manufacturers , and are in place because rider safety is its main priority .
author: Tim Page
News Editor, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: football : tns begin summer clear-out
text: the new saints of oswestry have started rebuilding for next season after winning the welsh treble for the second successive year .
out go long-serving favourite mike wilde , along with kai edwards and ryan edwards .

and following on from last week 's signing of the qpr under-21 player tom matthews , the club 's also brought in the dumbarton and former hamilton scottish premier league midfielder jon routledge ( above ) .
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: bridgnorth pub drug dealer gets two-and-a-half years
text: a drug dealer from bridgnorth has been jailed for two-and-a-half years after being caught red-handed in a pub in the town .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: text helpline for teenagers with sex questions
text: teenagers have got a new text helpline in shropshire , offering sex advice .
chathealth has been set up by the shropshire community healh trust and aims to help young people who are too embarrassed to speak to someone face to face .
the service can also be used to get advice on bullying , illnesses or to make an appointment with a school nurse .
the chathealth number is 07507 330346 and is available from monday to friday , between 09:00 and 16:30 .

we know this is a popular service as we have looked at other areas of the country where it has already been launched where young people say they feel less embarrassed , it is quick and easy , it is anonymous and non-judgemental
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Local Live

documents.title: inspectors investigating warehouse collapse
text: health and safety inspectors are at the shropshire warehouse where a man was trapped for eight hours on friday .

they 'll be trying to find out why metal racking , stacked with cheese , collapsed on top of fork-lift truck-driver tomasz wiszniewski , who was working inside the cold-store at edwards transport , near hinstock .
author: Andrew Hewkin
Newsreader, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: shredding vehicle catches fire in telford centre
text: a large paper-shredding truck has caught fire in telford town centre .
the fire service say they were called out at 11:13 and the fire was out by 11:30 , but as a precaution they 've had to empty out the whole load of shredded paper , in central square .
they 're still there , checking it over , as a precaution .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Local Live

documents.title: headlines : shrewsbury woman 's alton towers complaint ; hse investigates warehouse collapse
text: these are our top stories this lunchtime :
- alton towers investigating complaint from shrewsbury woman with one hand
- health and safety investigators look into hinstock warehouse collapse
- new text helpline for teenagers wanting sex advice
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Local Live

documents.title: lifeline given to rare woodland butterfly
text: a lifeline has been given to one of the rarest butterflies in the west midlands .
a grant of £ 98,400 from the heritage lottery fund will see the wood white reintroduced into four woodland sites across herefordshire , worcestershire and shropshire .

according to wildlife charity butterfly conservation , the wood white is one of the uk 's fastest declining butterflies and is found on just 50 sites across the country , with 42 % of these found in the west midlands .
the wood white is a very pretty and delicate butterfly and it really needs our help if we want to secure its future here in the west midlands . ''
author: Claudia Berry
Producer, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: cricket : comfortable win for shrewsbury
text: in the birmingham league , last year 's champions shrewsbury were comfortable seven-wicket winners over leamington , who were skittled for 87 at the weekend .
in division one , newly promoted bridgnorth edged to a five-run win over brockhampton , but wellington lost .
lower down the ladder , there were wins for shifnal and oswestry , while newport , whitchurch and worfield all lost .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: weather : warm , with some cloud overhead this afternoon
text: it 's going to be warm this afternoon , with temperatures up to 22c ( 77f ) and there will be some cloud overhead .
author: Alexandra Hamilton
BBC Weather

documents.title: watch : dancing at church stretton 's first musicfest event
text: church stretton held its first ever musicfest at the weekend , with more than 200 musicians taking part in a series of open-air performances .
and alongside the lute-players , accordionists and bell-ringers there were falconry displays , a singing workshop and a class to teach people how to dance the charleston .
author: Paul Shuttleworth
Presenter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: cricket : shropshire make one change for worcestershire match
text: shropshire have made one change to the side that beat wales , for their match with first-class county neighbours worcestershire .
jack mciver replaces the unavailable ollie westbury in the one-day challenge at shifnal on friday evening .
mciver is an off-spin bowler and middle order batsman , who only joined shifnal this year .
he 's previously played for the national universities side as well as nottinghamshire seconds .
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: your plenty to choose from after the sunny weekend
text: some great were taken by weather watchers in shropshire over the weekend .
here 's just a handful - first up from ludlow ( jan 's patch ) and edgmond ( microflyer ) .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: rick astley added to v festival line-up
text: rick astley , famous for singing hits including never gon na give you up and together forever has been added to the line-up for this summer 's v festival at weston park .
the 80s star has sold more than 40 million records and has got another album out next month .
other acts appearing on 20 and 21 august include justin bieber , rihanna , little mix and rita ora .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Local Live

documents.title: thousands turn out for charity ride
text: up to 7,000 motorcyclists and scooter riders turned out in shropshire for the annual bike 4 life fest .
the event , which runs from shrewsbury to raf cosford , helps to raise money for midlands air ambulance .
organiser helen stevens says it 's hard to believe how popular it 's become .
days like today do n't feel like work we could n't be prouder of the attendance and the support we receive

documents.title: woman with one hand claims she was turned away from smiler ride
text: alton towers says it 's looking into claims a shrewsbury woman was arbitrarily turned away from the smiler ride , because she only has one hand .
sarah pond says she 'd been on the rollercoaster about 10 times in the past , despite being born with part of her left arm missing .
but she says what made things worse on friday was when someone with a broken-arm in a cast was allowed on .

alton towers ' parent company merlin entertainment is facing a multimillion-pound fine for breaking health and safety rules when the smiler ride crashed last summer , leaving five people seriously injured .
author: Andrew Hewkin
Newsreader, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: headlines : claims woman turned away from ride ; jury to resume deliberations in trial of vicar accused of indecent assault
text: our top stories this morning :
- shrewsbury woman with one hand claims she was turned away from alton towers ride
- jury to resume its deliberations into the case of a retired vicar , accused of indecent assault
- up to 7,000 bikers turn out for charity ride
author: Carlie Swain
BBC Local Live

documents.title: hinstock warehouse collapse : probe starting after man buried by cheese
text: investigations were today expected to begin at the shropshire warehouse where a man was trapped under hundreds of blocks of cheese for nine hours .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: football : shrewsbury town end season on a loss
text: shrewsbury town lost 3-0 at swindon yesterday in their final game of the league one campaign .
larnell cole came close for shrewsbury , but his shot was blocked .
town finished 20th , four points above the relegation zone .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: junior doctors to meet telford mp over 'demotivating ' comments
text: an mp has angered junior doctors who say she is suggesting residents in her constituency are not intelligent enough to work in the profession .
telford 's lucy allan said it was `` wrong to suggest we are a constituency that is a liberal elite of highly-educated people - we 're absolutely not . ''
she said her constituents `` do not have the opportunities that doctors have '' .
ami jones , who grew up in telford and is now a consultant in abergavenny , said : `` she is de-motivating the young people of telford . ''
members of the facebook group junior doctors of telford have arranged to meet ms allan on 10 june .

documents.title: logan 's one lucky pup
text: here 's the moment a puppy was rescued after falling into an old lime kiln .
the seven-month-old fell 25ft ( 7.6m ) into the brick-lined pit when he was out for a walk with his owners in lime kiln woods , wellington , at the weekend .
firefighter chris lockett was winched in to rescued the pup , who was fortunately unhurt .

documents.title: headlines : mp angers junior doctors in 'opportunities ' row ; shrewsbury beaten in last game
text: here are some of the stories we 're looking at this morning :
- mp suggests telford people are not educated enough for doctor roles
- up to 7,000 motorcyclists and scooter riders take part in bike 4 life event
- shrewsbury town end season with a defeat
author: Carlie Swain
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : another beautiful day
text: warm and sunny today , highs of 23c ( 73f ) .
there may be the odd isolated shower later , but that should ease by the evening leaving a dry night .
here 's the latest forecast .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: travel : no problems on the roads
text: traffic is moving well across the county , but roadworks may hold you up .
works continue on roman road , in shrewsbury , and through abbey foregate .
shore lane , in cressage , is closed for roadworks near crown lane .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: good morning from bbc local live for shropshire
text: i 'm in the bbc shropshire newsroom with the latest news , sport , travel and weather .
if you see something we should be covering or want to share your or views , email us , tweet , or check out our facebook page .
author: Carlie Swain
BBC Local Live
